title: Developer AI Acceleration
summary: 2,500 developers use Claude Code for AI-assisted development, achieving 70% faster junior developer onboarding and 20-30% increase in feature velocity.

content.whatItIs: Palo Alto Networks represents an embedded AI adoption model where 2,500 developers across the cybersecurity company use Claude Code (Anthropic) as their primary AI development assistant. Rather than creating a separate AI lab, the company integrates AI tools directly into existing development workflows.
howItWorks: Claude Code deployed to entire 2,500-developer workforce as standard development tool
AI assists with code generation, review, documentation, and debugging
Junior developers use AI for accelerated onboarding - learning codebases 70% faster
Senior developers leverage AI for increased feature velocity (20-30% improvement)
No separate AI team - capability embedded in existing engineering organization
content.coreInsight: The embedded model treats AI as a productivity multiplier within existing roles rather than a separate capability. The 70% faster onboarding metric suggests AI can flatten the experience curve - junior developers can contribute meaningfully much sooner.
content.keyMetrics: 2,500 developers on Claude Code, 70% faster junior developer onboarding, 20-30% feature velocity increase
